It’s Friday 13th and while you may be feeling a bit wary, you can rest assured that you will never be as unlucky as these soap characters from EastEnders, Coronation Street, Emmerdale and Hollyoaks. 

While Walford and Weatherfield are always risky places to live what with death, disaster and pain being around every corner, some characters are hit with even more woes than usually found in our favourite soaps.

Here is a roundup of the most ill fated faces in the soaps in the hope that they will make you feel a little better on this superstitious day…

After two tough Eurovision semi finals, we now know the 26 countries that will contest the 2016 Eurovision Song Contest final on Saturday night. We don’t yet know the running order of the final, but there are some interesting situations that might well affect the outcome on Saturday night. Here’s our analysis of how the semi final results affect chances of success in Saturday’s Eurovision Song Contest final.

The 26 countries that will compete in the 2016 Eurovision Song Contest final on Saturday are:

… Read the full story]]> http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/12/eurovision-2016-the-second-semi-final-results-might-have-just-changed-everything-5878685/feed/ 0 Benny Royston _AP64010 bennyroy _AP64010 Eurovision 2016 semi final 2: FYR Macedonia’s Kaliopi just hit the most horrific high note http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/12/eurovision-2016-semi-final-2-fyr-macedonia-just-hit-the-most-horrific-high-note-5878589/ http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/12/eurovision-2016-semi-final-2-fyr-macedonia-just-hit-the-most-horrific-high-note-5878589/#respond Thu, 12 May 2016 20:17:13 +0000 http://metro.co.uk/?p=5878589 ]]>

The Eurovision 2016 contestant for F.Y.R. Macedonia just hit a pretty shocking high note.

Singer Kaliopi was rocking the stage at the second semi-final with her song Dona.

Powerful vocals, dramatic lighting and Kaliopi’s stage presence made for a spellbinding performance.

Emmerdale fans are currently once again very worried for the future of Robert Sugden and Aaron Dingle – or Robron as they are affectionely known – but Danny Miller has spoken out to put fears to rest and assured that the love between them is strong. 

In the wake of Gordon’s death, Aaron has started to harbour doubts that Robert had a hand in the fatality, leaving fans absolutely furious. And the situation could be about to be made worse by shocking action from Liv.

‘F*** this show!’ Fans lash out at Emmerdale as Robert Sugden is accused of killing… Read the full story]]> http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/12/emmerdale-spoilers-aaron-deserves-to-be-happy-and-robert-loves-him-danny-miller-on-robron-future-5878594/feed/ 0 robron kissing wallomrslug robron kissing robron ‘F*** this show!’ Fans lash out at Emmerdale as Robert Sugden is accused of killing Gordon Livesy http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/12/f-this-show-fans-lash-out-at-emmerdale-as-robert-sugden-is-accused-of-killing-gordon-livesy-5878566/ http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/12/f-this-show-fans-lash-out-at-emmerdale-as-robert-sugden-is-accused-of-killing-gordon-livesy-5878566/#respond Thu, 12 May 2016 19:47:31 +0000 http://metro.co.uk/?p=5878566 ]]>

They’re a loyal bunch, those Emmerdale fans – trust me, I am one – but could the show’s latest twist have pushed them too far as the blame for Gordon Livesy’s death has landed at the door of Robert Sugden? 

Since Aaron Dingle confided in Robert that Gordon abused him, Robert has been the epitome of the perfect man. He was there for Aaron, supported him and was patient with him and since the pair reunited, he hasn’t put a foot wrong.

But now that Gordon has been found dead, the fact that Robert burnt the letter has now left suspicions hanging over him that he could have had a… Read the full story]]> http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/12/f-this-show-fans-lash-out-at-emmerdale-as-robert-sugden-is-accused-of-killing-gordon-livesy-5878566/feed/ 0 robert gordon wallomrslug robert gordon Emmerdale spoilers: ITV soap airs a shock death but what happens next? http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/12/emmerdale-spoilers-itv-soap-airs-a-shock-death-but-what-happens-next-5878503/ http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/12/emmerdale-spoilers-itv-soap-airs-a-shock-death-but-what-happens-next-5878503/#respond Thu, 12 May 2016 18:27:23 +0000 http://metro.co.uk/?p=5878503 ]]>

Emmerdale have left fans reeling by airing the shock death of a character central to one of its biggest storylines of the year after Aaron Dingle was told that his father Gordon had been found dead in his prison cell. 

The surprise twist will change everything for Aaron – especially as Robert Sugden destroyed a letter from Gordon. Gordon was imprisoned after being found guilty of raping Aaron as a child – but could Gordon’s death be set to send him on another downward spiral?

As Aaron reels with the news, he will be left with a huge regret over the way he handled things, feeling like there were things left… Read the full story]]> http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/12/emmerdale-spoilers-itv-soap-airs-a-shock-death-but-what-happens-next-5878503/feed/ 0 emmerdale village wallomrslug emmerdale village FROM ITV STRICT EMBARGO - No Use Before Tuesday 3 May 2016 Emmerdale - Ep 7500 Thursday 12 May 2016 - 1st Ep Aaron Livsey’s [DANNY MILLER] chuffed when he receives his deed poll letter stating he’s now officially a Dingle. Chas Dingle [LUCY PARGETTER] and Charity begin to plan a Dingle family party to celebrate but Liv [ISOBEL STEELE] and Robert Sugdne [RYAN HAWLEY] are left feeling awkward as they’re excluded from the family celebrations. But there’s more heartache still to come for troubled Aaron when DS Wise arrives with shocking news. There’s great news for fans of Scottish comedy Still Game – the hit series is returning for a new run after almost a decade since the last episodes airs. 

The return has been confirmed by the BBC after months of rumours. The show went off air amid rumours of differences between stars and writers Greg Hemphill and Ford Kiernan.

The pair restored their comedy partnership, which was also behind the sketch show Chewin’ The Fat, for a stage version of Still Game which proved immensely popular, with a sold out 21 night run last year.

LeBlanc's appointment marks the first time the show has ever had a non-British host in its 39-year history. In what promises to be an explosive cocktail of car-obsessed entertainers and cultural clashes - the eagerly anticipated return of the revamped show is expected to noisily announce itself on BBC Two and TV screens everywhere this May. The Golden Globe-winning star of the popular BBC comedy Episodes, LeBlanc's international appeal has never been stronger despite filming the finale of his global hit Friends almost 12 years ago. He's already a familiar face to Top Gear viewers, having been a two-time guest on the show and the fastest celebrity to date around the Top Gear track in its reasonably priced car. LeBlanc also presented the recent standalone spin-off Top Gear: The Races, where he led fans through some of the most memorable racing moments from the previous 22 series. He joins production immediately and additional Top Gear cast members will be confirmed shortly. Chris Evans said of his new Top Gear presenter: "Matt's a lifelong fellow petrolhead and I'm thrilled he's joining Top Gear. Acting out our craziest car notions on screen is a dream job and I know we'll both be debating some epic road trip ideas. We can't wait to share what we've been up to on screen later this year." Matt LeBlanc commented: "As a car nut and a massive fan of Top Gear, I'm honoured and excited to be a part of this iconic show's new chapter. What a thrill!" Alan Tyler, the BBC's Acting Controller for Entertainment Commissioning said: "Matt is a class act and a brilliant signing for Top Gear. He is a self-confessed car fanatic with a passion for the programme. I'm really looking forward to watching Chris and Matt bring the all new show to our audiences." Notes To Editors: Biogs MATT LEBLANC Matt is an American actor, comedian and producer, best known for his role as Joey Tribbiani on the NBC sitcom, Friends. In 2011, LeBlanc began starring as a fictional version of himself in Episodes, a BBC Two/Showtime television series created by the Friends co-creators. He won a Golden Globe award for his work on Episodes, and was nominated for an Emmy three times for his work on Friends and four times for Episodes. Matt holds the record for the fastest ever celebrity lap of the famous Top Gear track, having appeared as a guest in Season 18 Episode 2 (TX 5th Feb 2012) setting a still unbeaten 1m42.1sec in the Kia C'eed. Matt also reappeared on the show in S19 E4 (TX 17th Feb 2013) when he was asked to test the new Kia C'eed on the track, against the old one. Matt's love of all things four and two wheeled will come as no surprise to Top Gear fans. Whilst on set for his guest appearance, Matt also spent as much time as he was allowed driving the McLaren 12C supercar around the Top Gear track, accompanied by The Stig. CHRIS EVANS Chris Evans is one of Britain's most high-profile and successful presenters. He was born in 1966, in Warrington, England. His entrepreneurial zeal emerged at an early age, when he ran the local newsagents in his home town of Warrington and set up his own Kiss-o-gram and Private Detective agencies. He started his broadcasting career at Piccadilly Radio then moved to GLR, where his infamous Round at Chris' Saturday morning show attracted a huge cult following and he later took the format to Virgin 1215. In 1993, Chris formed his own company called Ginger Productions to formulate a brand new variety show for Saturday nights: Don't Forget Your Toothbrush. Devised, written and performed by Chris, the ratings peaked at a combined 6 million viewers. He revitalised BBC Radio 1 with his Radio 1 Breakfast Show before bowing out to concentrate on his unique end-of-the-week TV show on Channel 4, TFI Friday. TFI ran for 5 years, before finishing on 22 December 2000 with a show hosted by Elton John. In 2010 he took over BBC Radio 2's Breakfast Show following the retirement of Irish-born broadcasting legend Sir Terry Wogan. His show is currently the UK's most listened to - with over 10 million listeners tuning in each week. Top Gear Culture Secretary John Whittingdale delivers a statement in the House of Commons, London, after the publishing of a long-awaited White Paper on the BBC's future. PRESS ASSOCIATION Photo. Tuesday’s first semi final saw ten countries qualify for Saturday’s final and the last ten places are up for grabs from 18 songs competing in semi final two.

Philomena Cunk has become such a favourite with viewers she’s been given her own show about Shakespeare.

You may have seen Philomena, played by comedian Diane Morgan, on Charlie Brooker’s Screenwipe, but she’s branched out and we’re loving it.

As one of many BBC programmes to mark the 200th anniversary of Shakespeare’s death, Cunk gave her own irrevent and quirky take on the Bard’s work for a special one-off show.

It was only 30 minutes long but it was jam-packed with jokes and had many clamoruing for her to be given her own series.

We’ve rounded up some of the best gags from Cunk On Shakespeare.

George R R Martin has made a chapter from the next Game Of Thrones book available to read online.

The author posted the extract on his website and reassured fans that he was still at work on the book.

The Winds Of Winter is the sixth installment in Martin’s A Song Of Ice And Fire series.

He added that fans may have heard him read the chapter and conventions, but this is the first time it will appear in print.

MORE: Game Of Thrones season 6 episode 3: People are convinced there was a fart joke in Oathbreaker

I’m A Celebrity…Get Me Out Of Here might have its first contestant in the bag.

Ex-Geordie Shore star Sophie Kasaei was very secretive about the news on Twitter, which could suggest that she will be on her way to Australia later this year.

Sophie was booted off the reality TV series in 2013 after she was allegedly overheard making a racist comment on camera.

She came back to the show recently when she rejoined the Geordie Shore gang for the fifth anniversary special.

Her next stop could be jungle if her recent tweet was anything to go by.

For years, arguments have raged about whether The Eurovision Song Contest is dominated by political voting or is too political in it’s nature. One of the most interesting things about the results from the first Eurovision semi final this year is that politics cannot be seen to have had any effect on which countries qualified.

Voting is part of what makes the Eurovision Song Contest special. There have been some incredibly tense moments, with hearts broken and national explosions of joy over the years.
